security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and transformation instructions for AI-assisted SQL to OSC conversion. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, environment variables, or external commands.

content.user_title: Convert SQL migrations to OSC format
content.value_statement: Database migrations using Flyway require conversion for online schema changes. This skill transforms standard SQL migration scripts into OSC format for zero-downtime deployments.
actual_capabilities: Parse Flyway SQL migration files from standard location
Extract database name, table name, and operations from SQL statements
Convert ALTER TABLE statements to OSC format
Transform CREATE INDEX to ADD INDEX syntax
Format output as TAB-separated OSC lines
Generate conversion summary with operation statistics
limitations: Does not validate SQL syntax or schema correctness
Only processes standard Flyway migration file patterns
Does not execute migrations or connect to databases
Requires manual review before production deployment

prompt_templates.title: Basic conversion

prompt_templates.title: With summary

prompt_templates.title: Format verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this SQL to OSC format and verify the output meets UTF-8 encoding, TAB separators, and proper line endings.

output_examples.input: Convert the SQL migration V1.0__alter_users.sql to OSC format

best_practices: Always review OSC output before deployment to catch any missed conversions
Use today's date in osc filename to maintain proper version ordering
Keep original SQL migration files as audit trail alongside OSC output
anti_patterns: Skipping manual review of OSC output before production deployment
Converting without reading the full SQL file context
Using OSC format for databases that do not support online schema changes

faq.question: What databases support OSC format?
faq.answer: OSC is commonly used with MySQL online schema change tools. Check your database tool documentation for compatibility.

faq.question: What is the output file naming convention?
faq.answer: Output files follow the pattern osc-YYYYMMDD.txt and are placed in src/main/resources/db/osc/ directory.

faq.question: Does this skill execute SQL on my database?
faq.answer: No, this skill only transforms SQL text to OSC format. It does not connect to or modify any database.

faq.question: What SQL statements are supported?
faq.answer: Supports USE, ALTER TABLE, CREATE INDEX statements following Flyway naming conventions.

faq.question: How do I handle multiple operations on one table?
faq.answer: Comma-join operations without spaces, e.g., ADD COLUMN col1,ADD INDEX idx1 (col1);

faq.question: What encoding should the output use?
faq.answer: UTF-8 without BOM with LF line endings and TAB separators between columns.
